justification: Hauser et al. (2017) used the RL model incorporating perseverance to evaluate OCD patients and healthy controls, identifying a significant difference in the perseverance parameter between the two groups.

measured_by: RL model with asymmetric learning rates
justification: Suzuki et al. (2023) demonstrated that OCD patients exhibited a reduced learning rate for negative reward prediction errors and altered neural representations in the dorsal striatum and dmPFC, measured using fMRI, compared to healthy controls.

measured_by: RL model with asymmetric learning rates
justification: GD patients exhibited altered learning rates for positive and negative reward prediction errors, as measured by the RL model with asymmetric learning rates (Suzuki et al., 2023). This was associated with enhanced neural responses in the anterior insula.

measured_by: RL models with choice perseverance and asymmetric learning rates
justification: Behavioral inflexibility was captured by RL models incorporating choice perseverance and asymmetric learning rates, with the perseverance parameter being significantly different between OCD patients and healthy controls (Hauser et al., 2017).

measured_by: RL model parameters (learning rate, inverse temperature)
justification: A greater degree of noise in decision-making (lower inverse temperature) and altered learning rates were identified for patients with mood and anxiety disorders when using RL models to analyze their decision-making behavior (Aylward et al., 2019).
